sen.j: 和弓（わきゅう）とは、日本の弓道・弓術及びそこで使用される長弓の弓 (武器)のこと。
sen.e: Wakyu is the Chokyu (long bow) (weapon) used in Japanese Kyudo (Japanese art of archery).
Wakyu is the Chokyu (long bow) (weapon) used in Japanese Kyudo (Japanese art of archery).
Wakyu is the Chokyu (long bow) (weapon) used in Japanese Kyudo (Japanese art of archery).

sen.j: 全長は七尺三寸（約221cm）を標準とされており、「和弓」とは洋弓（アーチェリー）に対する語。
sen.e: Its standard length is determined to be 7 shaku and 3 sun (approximately 221 cm) and the term, 'wakyu' is used in opposed to the western archery.
Its standard length is determined to be seven shaku and three sun (approximately 221 cm) and the term, 'wakyu' is used in opposed to the western archery.
sen.cmt: 7 shaku 3 sun→seven shaku three sunとしました。
sen.e: Its standard length is determined to be seven shaku and three sun (approximately 221 cm) and the term, 'wakyu' is used in opposed to the western archery.

sen.j: 古来は大弓（だいきゅう）と呼ばれており、全長およそ2m以上のものを大弓、それ以下のもの（約45cm〜160cm程度）を半弓として区別していた。
sen.e: It was called as Daikyu in ancient times, and those that were longer than 2 m was called as Daikyu, and shorter bows (approximately 45 to 160 cm) were labeled as Hankyu small-sized bow.
It was called as Daikyu in ancient times, and those that were longer than 2 m was called as Daikyu, and shorter bows (approximately 45 to 160 cm) were labeled as Hankyu small-sized bow.

sen.j: 洋弓が全長160cm前後、弓の中心を把持しハンドル、リム等にパーツが別れている構造である。
sen.e: The western bow has a span of approximately 160 cm and segregated into parts such as the central handle and rims.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The western bow has a span of approximately 160 cm and segregated into parts such as the central handle and rims.

sen.j: それに対し、和弓は全長が標準で七尺三寸（約221cm）、下から3分の1、弓の中心から見て下部寄りを把持し（上長下短）下から上まで全長に渡ってひと繋がりの構造となっており、全長だけ見れば和弓は世界最大の弓である。
sen.e: Meanwhile, the daikyu has a standard length of 221 cm that is biggest in the world by observing just length, handle being located at one-third length from the bottom, and made from one unit structure.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Meanwhile, the wakyu has a standard length of 221 cm that is biggest in the world by observing just length, the grip being positioned at one-third length from the bottom, lowered as seen from the center of the bow (the longer top and short bottom) and it is made from one unit structure.
sen.cmt: 「弓の中心から見て下部寄りを把持し（上長下短）」→訳漏れのため訳出daikyu→wakyuに修正、handle being located→the grip being positionedとし、made fromの前にit is追加
sen.e: Meanwhile, the wakyu has a standard length of 221 cm that is biggest in the world by observing just length, the grip being positioned at one-third length from the bottom, lowered as seen from the center of the bow (the longer top and short bottom) and it is made from one unit structure.

sen.j: 上長下短の構造は一見バランスが悪いように見えるが、握りの位置が丁度弓の震動の節にあたり、持ち手に来る振動が少ないという利点がある。
sen.e: While it seems as though the longer top and short bottom seem to be unbalanced, the grip rests at the center of the vibration and brings less vibration to the archer.
While it seems as though the longer top and short bottom seem to be unbalanced, the grip rests at the center of the vibration and brings less vibration to the archer.

sen.j: また高度な技術ではあるが、上下の長さの差から来る弓の上下の反発力の違いを利用し、矢の飛び方に変化（飛距離を出す、鋭く飛ばす、等）を付ける事が出来る。
sen.e: Although advanced in skill, one could use the difference in the reflection of upper and lower body of the bow, and control the way arrows are shot (give more flight distance, fly it straight, and etc.).
Although advanced in skill, one could use the difference in the reflection of upper and lower body of the bow, and control the way arrows are shot (give more flight distance, fly it straight, etc.).

sen.j: 一説では弓を張った状態で矢を番える位置で分けた弓の上下の長さの比率が黄金比に近く、和弓の美しさの所以とも言われている。
sen.e: One theory stated that the beauty of wakyu is due to the distance between the top of the bow to where the arrow is cocked, and its distance to the bottom part lies in a golden ratio.
One theory holds that the beauty of wakyu is due to the golden ratio created by the distances between the top of the bow to where the arrow is cocked, and to the bottom part.
sen.cmt: One theory stated that→one theory holds thatとしました。
sen.e: One theory holds that the beauty of wakyu is due to the golden ratio that exists between the distance from the top of the bow to where the arrow is cocked and the distance from where the arrow is cocked to the bottom of the bow.
sen.cmt: 原文に合わせて訳文を修正

sen.j: 弓は原則として左手に持ち、矢は弓の右側に番え（洋弓は左側）、右手に弽（ゆがけ）を挿して（はめて）引く。
sen.e: The bow is held generally in left hand and the arrow is placed on the right side of the bow (western bow cocks it toward left) before the string is pulled with a right hand covered by yugake (hand protector).

The bow is held generally in left hand and the arrow is placed on the right side of the bow (western bow cocks it toward left) before the string is pulled with a right hand covered by yugake (hand protector).

sen.j: 取り掛けは右手親指根辺りで弦を保持し、筈を人差し指根で抱え込むように保持する蒙古式を取る（洋弓は人差し指〜薬指で弦を保持する地中海式）。
sen.e: The tsuru (bowstring) is held at the bottom of the right thumb and hazu (nock of an arrow) is held in a Menggu (Mongol) style by with an index finger (the western bow holds the string with the index to the ring finger in Mediterranean style).

The tsuru (bowstring) is held at the bottom of the right thumb and hazu (nock of an arrow) is held in a Mongolian style by with an index finger (the western bow holds the string with the index to the ring finger in a Mediterranean style).
sen.cmt: a Menggu (Mongol) style→ a Mongolian style、in Mediterranean style→a Mediterranean styleとしました。
sen.e: The tsuru (bowstring) is held at the bottom of the right thumb and hazu (nock of an arrow) is held in a Mongolian style by with an index finger (the western bow holds the string with the index to the ring finger in a Mediterranean style).

sen.j: 上から大きく引き下ろし、最終的に右手が右肩辺り、弦が耳の後ろに来るまで大きく引く。
sen.e: It is pulled strongly down from the top until the right hand ends up at the right shoulder, and the tsuru is pulled back toward behind ears.

sen.j: 弓の全長は直線距離ではなく、弓の曲線に沿った長さを測る。
sen.e: The length of the bow is not the direct distance from ends of the bow but measured along the curve of the bow.
The length of the bow is not the direct distance from end to end of the bow but measured along the curve of the bow.

sen.j: すなわち、素材そのものが持つ長さである。
sen.e: In another words, it is a length of the material itself.

sen.j: 標準とされている七尺三寸は「並寸（なみすん）」と言い、七尺五寸（約227cm）を「伸び寸（のびすん）」或は「二寸伸び（にすんのび）」、七尺七寸（約233cm）を「四寸伸び（よんすんのび）」、七尺（約212cm）を「三寸詰め（さんすんづめ）」或は「寸詰め（すんづめ）」としている。
sen.e: The 7 shaku 3 sun (approximately 221cm) is called as 'Namisun' (Average sun (3.03cm)), and the seven shaku five sun (approximately 227 cm) that extends is called as 'Nobi sun' (Extended sun) or 'Ni sun nobi' (extension by two sun), seven shaku seven sun (approximately 223 cm) as 'Yon sun nobi' (extended by four sun), and seven shaku (approximately 212 cm) as 'san sun zume' (contracted by three sun) or 'sun zume' (contraction by a sun (3.03 cm))

The seven shaku three sun (approximately 221cm) is called as 'Nami sun' (Average sun (3.03cm)), and the seven shaku five sun (approximately 227 cm) that extends is called as 'Nobi sun' (Extended sun) or 'Ni sun nobi' (extension by two sun), seven shaku seven sun (approximately 233 cm) as 'Yon sun nobi' (extended by four sun), and seven shaku (approximately 212 cm) as 'san sun zume' (contracted by three sun) or 'sun zume' (contraction by a sun (3.03 cm)).
sen.cmt: 7 shaku 3 sun→seven shaku three sun、Namisun→Nami sunとし、余分なスペース消去、ピリオド追加、223 cm→233 cmに修正

sen.j: それぞれ射手の体格や身長から来る矢和弓の矢の長さに適した長さの弓を選ぶ必要があり、一般的には矢束85cm程度までは並寸、90cm程度までは伸び寸、95cm程度までは四寸伸び、80cm以下で七尺とされている。
sen.e: Wakyu bow length depends on the matching body composition and the height of the archer, and the average arrow length of up to 85 cm was determined to be nami sun (average sun), up to 90 cm was nobi sun (extended sun), up to 95 cm was 4 sun nobi (extended by 12.12 cm), and those shorter than 80cm was considered to be seven shaku (2.121 cm).

sen.j: 全日本弓道連盟では、『弓の長さは221cm（7尺3寸）を基準とし、射手の身長または競技の種類により若干の長短を認められる。』
sen.e: According to the All Nippon Kyudo Federation, "the standard bow length is 221 cm (7 shaku 3 sun), but the slight lengthening and shortening of a bow is allowed depending on the height of the archer or the type of the tournament.

sen.j: 和弓は全体的に滑らかな曲線を描くが、その独特の曲線で構成された弓の姿を成りと言う。
sen.e: Wakyu generally forms an unique smooth curve called as nari (shape of the bow).

sen.j: 弓に弦を張った状態での姿を張り顔・成り、充分に引いた時の弓の姿を引き成り、弦を外した状態では裏反りと呼び、それぞれ弓の性格や手入れする際に見る重要な要素である。
sen.e: It is called harigao (stetched face) or nari when the tsuru of the bow is taunt, hikinari (shape of the bow when pulled) when the bow is pulled, and Urazori (bow bending in an opposite direction, when the tsuru taking off from the bow) when tsuru is released, and these are important elements need to be observed when handling each bow characteristic and management.

sen.j: 和弓は基本的に5つの成り場で構成される。
sen.e: Wakyu is generally formed from five nari.

sen.j: 下から小反り、大腰、胴、鳥打ち、姫反りと呼ばれ、5カ所それぞれの反発力の強弱バランスによって張り顔は成り立ち、また弓の性能を引き出している。
sen.e: The five locations are called from the bottom, kozori (small curve), oogoshi (area around the belt), do (stomach), toriuchi (37-38 cm below the upper area of the bow), hime zori (princess sori) and hari gao (face of the extended string), and different harigao and strengths are formed from the reflection strength balance.

sen.j: また射手の好みや癖、材料の個体差から来る要因から弓の成りは一定ではなく、一張り毎に少しずつ張り顔は違う。

sen.e: The wakyu is not straight when viewed with the tsuru nearby and yugara (wooden or bamboo part between Motohazu (the lower top of the bow) and Urahazu (the top of the bow)) further away, and the tsuru is placed slightly left in order to make it located at the right edge of yugara where the arrow is placed.

sen.j: この弦が弓の右端に位置する状態を入木（いりき）と呼び、矢を真っ直ぐ飛ばす為に必要な反りとなっている。

tit.cmt: 前出の「構造」の対訳が"Structure"となっているため、Designとしました。

sen.j: 伝統的な竹弓は基本的に三層構造をしており、弦側から内竹（うちたけ：前竹〔まえたけ〕ともいう）・中打ち（なかうち）・外竹（とだけ）と呼ばれ、中打ちを芯材に、内竹、外竹で前後から挟み合わせた形となっている。
sen.e: The traditional bamboo bow has basic three layered structure, and called from the side of the bowtsuru, Uchitake (inner bamboo) (also called as maetake (in front of a bamboo), naka uchi (inner hit), todake (outer hit), and nakauchi is sandwiched between uchitake and todake.

The traditional bamboo bow has basic three layered structure, and called from the side of the bowstring, uchitake (inner bamboo) (also called as maetake), nakauchi (inner hit), todake (outer hit), and nakauchi is sandwiched between uchitake and todake.
sen.cmt: bowtsuru→bowstring、Uchitake→uchitakeとし、(in front of a bamboo)削除、naka uchi→nakauchiとしました。
sen.e: The traditional bamboo bow has basic three layered structure, and called from the side of the bowstring, uchitake (inner bamboo) (also called as maetake), nakauchi (inner hit), todake (outer hit), and nakauchi is sandwiched between uchitake and todake.

sen.j: 中打ちはさらにヒゴと呼ばれる黒く焦がした短冊状の竹を数本横並びに重ね合わせ、さらにその両脇を木で挟み込んでいる。
sen.e: Nakauchi has layers of charcoaled strips of bamboo called higo piled up in a row and sandwiched between layer of wood.

sen.e: The most bottom part of yazurido is called as 'Togashira' and yazurido is bound from this area.

sen.j: 現在、試合等では弓道連盟の規定により6cm以上の高さが必要だが、かつては流派により巻き様式があった。
sen.e: Currently, the Kyudo Federation requires the wakyu to be bound more than six centimeters, but it used to be bound differently depending on the archery school.

sen.j: 握り（にぎり）
sen.e: Nigiri (Grip)
Nigiri (grip)
Nigiri (grip)

sen.j: 「弣弓へんに付（ゆづか）」「弓束（ゆづか）」とも。
sen.e: It is also called as 'Yuzuka' (written as '弣' or 'Yuzuka' (The handle of a Japanese bow)).
It is also called as 'Yuzuka' (The grip of a Japanese bow).
sen.cmt: (written as '弣' or 'Yuzuka')削除、 handle→gripとしました。
sen.e: It is also called as 'Yuzuka' (The grip of a Japanese bow).

sen.j: その名の通り、弓を握る部分。
sen.e: It is the area used to grip the bow as the name implies.
It is the area used to grip the bow as the name implies.
It is the area used to grip the bow as the name implies.

sen.j: 矢摺籐と接する形で握り革を巻く。
sen.e: It is located adjacent to yazurido and a leather for nigiri is bound.
It is located adjacent to yazurido and a leather for nigiri is bound.
It is located adjacent to yazurido and a leather for nigiri is bound.

sen.j: 手の内の当る重要な部分で、柔らかく吸湿性のある鹿革を巻く。
sen.e: It is the most important part that lies within the palm of the archer, and uses a deer leather that is soft and keeps in moisture.
It is the most important part that lies within the palm of the archer, and uses a deer leather that is soft and keeps in moisture.

sen.j: 弦 (弓)（つる）
sen.e: Tsuru (bowstring)
Tsuru (bowstring)
Tsuru (bowstring)

sen.j: 弓の間に張った丈夫な紐或は糸状のもの。
sen.e: It is a strong cord or string strung between the bow.
It is a strong cord or string strung between the bow.
It is a strong cord or string strung between the bow.

sen.j: 伝統的な麻弦は 麻・苧麻（カラムシ）等を原料に、繊維をこより薬練（くすね：「天鼠」とも書く）を塗る、若しくは染み込ませ補強したもの。
sen.e: The traditional hemp string uses hemp or karamushi (choma (hemp)) with kusune (written as 'Kusune' (pine-resin) or also as '天鼠') painted or soaked in it.
The traditional hemp string uses hemp or karamushi (choma (hemp)) with kusune (pine-resin) painted or soaked in it.
sen.cmt: (written as 'Kusune' (pine-resin) or also as '天鼠')→(pine-resin)のみとしました。
sen.e: The traditional hemp string uses hemp or karamushi (choma (hemp)) with kusune (pine-resin) painted or soaked in it.

sen.j: 弦の両端は弓に掛けるため弦環を作るが、環は独特な縛り方をする。
sen.e: The ends of the tsuru forms Tsuruwa (string loop) in order to string it to the bow, but Tsuruwa requires an unique knot.
The ends of the tsuru forms Tsuruwa (string loop) in order to string it to the bow, but Tsuruwa requires an unique knot.

sen.j: 現在はケプラー、ザイロン、アラミド繊維等の合成繊維製の弦が主流。
sen.e: In current days, the tsuru made from Kevlar, Zylon, and aramid fibers are commonly used.
In current days, the tsuru made from synthetic fibers such as Kevlar, Zylon, and aramid fibers are commonly used.
sen.cmt: 「等の合成繊維製の」→訳漏れのため 訳出
sen.e: In current days, the tsuru made from synthetic fibers such as Kevlar, Zylon, and aramid fibers are commonly used.

sen.j: 近年アーチェリー用のストリングを和弓用に改良した弦も現れた。
sen.e: Recently tsuru modified for wakyu began to appear on market.
Recently the archery string which is modified for wakyu tsuru began to appear on market.

sen.e: Recently the archery string which is modified for wakyu tsuru began to appear on market.
